title: Drawing, "Design for a clock", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed: Below center: L'amour pensant de la livre No. 150 21c
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Clock sits on footed base. At center, an oblong clock easel decorated with leaves, rosettes, wreath. "HOMERE / VIRGILE" written at center. Above dial are three books and a wreath. At left, on pedestal, a winged cupid plays a lyre. At right, on pedestal, a flaming candlestick with suspended lyre.
